Reason: The configuration option _clock is performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the clock() method is directly related to time management operations in the system. The method checks for the _clock variable and returns a Clock object accordingly. If the _clock variable is not null, it returns the _clock object, which might involve time-expensive operations. This configuration can lead to notable performance variations at the system level based on the type of Clock implementation set for _clock.
